intro: Randia brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed randia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Randia brevipes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
